intro: Hieracium chlorophyton subsp. chlorophyton, commonly known as the green hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lanceolate, with a rough texture, and the flowers are yellow, forming a flat-topped inflorescence. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
